DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study examine whether primary care weight management intervention deliver peer coach produce great weight loss self-directed program without peer coach support .
DOC.brief_title: Partnership Optimizes Weight Management Primary Care
DOC.criteria: Age 2175 year Body mass index ( BMI ) 3050 kg/m2 Receiving primary care service one practice participate study Uncontrolled hypertension ( blood pressure > 160/100 mm Hg screen ) Any follow medical condition : myocardial infarction cerebrovascular accident within last six month ; unstable angina within past six month ; NYHA Class III IV congestive heart failure ; type 1 diabetes ; cancer require treatment past five year ( exception : nonmelanoma skin cancer ) ; chronic lung disease limit physical activity Current use follow medication : antipsychotic agent , monoamine oxidase inhibitor , systemic corticosteroid , chemotherapeutic drug ; prescription weight loss medication ( past six month ) Unwilling unable following : give informed consent ; read/understand English ; accept random assignment ; travel intervention site Likely relocate area next 2 year Participation another randomize research project Weight loss > 10 pound past six month History bariatric surgery
